body_html:
Thanks for the report. I'm not familiar enough with what the convention is when it comes to packaging programs that depend on it.

I'll look into it.

CCing @meteorcloudy @gunan in case they have any thoughts (they may not).

tensorflow_jni.dll is built by this script, that invokes bazel. I see that the TensorFlow pip packages for Windows do not package MSVCP140.dll either. I'm not sure what the convention is when it comes to distributing it with a program, I'll try to dig into this.

body:
Thanks for the report. I'm not familiar enough with what the convention is when it comes to packaging programs that depend on it.

I'll look into it.

CCing @meteorcloudy @gunan in case they have any thoughts (they may not).

`tensorflow_jni.dll` is built by [this script](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/r1.4/tensorflow/tools/ci_build/windows/libtensorflow_cpu.sh#L53), that invokes bazel.  I see that the TensorFlow pip packages for Windows do not package `MSVCP140.dll` either. I'm not sure what the convention is when it comes to distributing it with a program, I'll try to dig into this.
